lead_paragraph: Sadaharu Oh, who hit 868 home runs in Japanese baseball, putting him No. 1 in the world for homers, had surgery for stomach cancer yesterday in Tokyo. Masaki Kitajima, a surgeon at Tokyo’s Keio University Hospital, told a news conference that the 66-year-old Oh’s stomach was removed because of cancer in the upper part. His condition was listed as good and he was expected to leave the hospital in about 10 days. Oh, the manager of the Fukuoka Softbank Hawks, managed Japan to the title in this year’s inaugural World Baseball Classic.
